TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MSBuild extends Microsoft.Build.Tasks.TaskExtension

Docs.summary: Implements the `MSBuild` task. Use the `MSBuild` element in your project file to create and execute this task. For usage and parameter information, see [MSBuild Task](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class implements the "MSBuild" task, which hands off child project files to the MSBuild engine to be built.
Marked RunInMTA because there is no reason MSBuild tasks should run on a thread other than that of the RequestBuilder which spawned them.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the projects specified in the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.MSBuild.Projects%2A> property are built in parallel, if possible.
Docs.value: if the projects specified in the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.MSBuild.Projects%2A> property are built in parallel if possible; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Execute() cil managed

Docs.summary: Instructs the MSBuild engine to build one or more project files whose locations are specified by the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.MSBuild.Projects%2A> property.
Docs.returns: if all projects build successfully; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the project files to build.
Gets or sets a semicolon-delimited list of property name/value pairs to apply as global properties to the child project.
Docs.value: A semicolon-delimited list of property name/value pairs to apply as global properties to the child project.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you specify this parameter, it is functionally equivalent to setting properties that have the **/property** switch when you build with .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the relative paths of target output items from the built projects have their paths adjusted to be relative to the calling project.
Docs.value: if the relative paths of target output items from the built projects have their paths adjusted to be relative to the calling project.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the set of global properties to remove.
Docs.value: Returns the set of global properties to remove.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/add/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] task invokes each target in the list passed to [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/add/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] one at a time, instead of at the same time.
Docs.value: if the [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/add/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] task invokes each target in the list passed to [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/add/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] one at a time; if the [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/add/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] task invokes all targets in the list at the same time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Setting this property to `true` guarantees that subsequent targets are invoked even if previously invoked targets failed. Otherwise, a build error would stop invocation of all subsequent targets. The default value is `false`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether project files that do not exist on the disk will be skipped.
Docs.value: if project files that do not exist on the disk will be skipped; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If project files that do not exist on the disk are not skipped, they will cause a build error.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the task should stop building the remaining projects as soon as any one of them may not work.
Docs.value: if the task should stop building the remaining projects as soon as any one of them may not work; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the escape characters to be unescaped from the specified <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.MSBuild.Properties%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.MSBuild.Targets%2A>.
Docs.value: The escape characters to be unescaped from the specified <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.MSBuild.Properties%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.MSBuild.Targets%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property has to be set to a value other than `null` for the `MSBuild` task to unescape properties and targets.

Docs.summary: Returns the outputs of the built targets from all the project files. Only the outputs from the targets that were specified are returned, not any outputs that may exist on targets that those targets depend on.
Docs.value: The outputs of the built targets from all the project files.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the target or targets to build in the project files. Use a semicolon to separate a list of target names.
Docs.value: The target or targets to build in the project files.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If no targets are specified in the `MSBuild` task, the default targets specified in the project files are built.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a target [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] version to build the project with, which enables an [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/add/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] task to build a project that targets a different version of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] than the one specified in the project. Valid values are , and .
Docs.value: The target [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] version to build the project with.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the project will be unloaded once the operation is completed.
Docs.value: if the project will be unloaded once the operation is completed; otherwise, . This property is no longer used in version 4.0

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the MSBuild engine will return the built targets from the cache.
Docs.value: if the MSBuild engine will return the built targets from the cache; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The scope of built targets in the cash is (ProjectFileName, GlobalProperties)[TargetNames] as a list of build items.
This property is no longer used in version 4.0.
